TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IPMath

Docs.summary: This type is a wrapper for a COM interface implemented by a coclass that is required by managed code for COM interoperability. To access the members specified by this interface, use the type that wraps the coclass that implements this interface. For information about that type, including usage, remarks, and examples, see.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Avg(class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.IXMLDOMNodeList pxmllistInput) cil managed
Public Function Avg (pxmllistInput As IXMLDOMNodeList) As Object

Docs.param: The node set that contains the values to be averaged.
Docs.summary: Gets the average value of all numerical elements in a node set.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the average value of all the numerical elements in a node set.

remarks.para: Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the variable is set to the average value of all of the numerical elements in the node set. is a simple field inside a repeating section or table.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Eval (Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.IXMLDOMNodeList pxmllistContext, string bstrExpression);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Eval(class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.IXMLDOMNodeList pxmllistContext, string bstrExpression) cil managed
Public Function Eval (pxmllistContext As IXMLDOMNodeList, bstrExpression As String) As Object

Docs.param: The node that sets the context for the expression.
The expression to be applied to each set of nodes in the specified context.
Docs.summary: Gets the sets of results calculated when the expression is applied to each set of elements in the context.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the set of results calculated when the expression is applied to each set of elements in the context.

remarks.para: Note: Accessing the object returned by the Eval method by casting it to the IXMLDOMNodeList type in a managed form may result in security exceptions, in which case the form should be given FullTrust permissions.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the variable is set to the largest cost value, where cost is calculated by multiplying price by quantity.
example.code: IXMLDOMNodeList items = thisXDocument.DOM.selectNodes(@"/my:items/my:item"); decimal maxCost = (decimal) thisXDocument.Util.Math.Max((IXMLDOMNodeList) thisXDocument.Util.Math.Eval(items, "price * quantity"));

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Max(class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.IXMLDOMNodeList pxmllistInput) cil managed
Public Function Max (pxmllistInput As IXMLDOMNodeList) As Object

Docs.param: The node set to search for the largest value.
Docs.summary: Gets the largest value of all of the numerical elements in a node set.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the largest value of all the numerical elements in a node set.

remarks.para: Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the variable is set to the largest age value in , and is returned in a repeating section or table with a field named "ages." An alert is also shown with the largest age value.

Docs.param: The node set to search for the smallest value.
Docs.summary: Gets the smallest value of all of the numerical elements in a node set.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the smallest value of all the numerical elements in a node set.

remarks.para: Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the variable is set to the smallest age value in , and is returned in a repeating section or table with a field named "ages." An alert is also shown with the smallest age value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Nz(class Microsoft.Office.Interop.InfoPath.SemiTrust.IXMLDOMNodeList pxmllistInput) cil managed
Public Function Nz (pxmllistInput As IXMLDOMNodeList) As Object

Docs.param: The node set that will have its empty values replaced with zeroes.
Docs.summary: Gets the node set passed to the function, except with zeros (0) where empty values existed before.
Docs.returns: An object that represents a node set.

remarks.para: An exception occurs if there are no empty values in the node set.

Note: Accessing the object returned by the Nz method by casting it to the IXMLDOMNodeList type in a managed form may result in security exceptions, in which case the form should be given FullTrust permissions.
Important: This member can be accessed without restrictions.

example.para: In the following example, the variable is set to a node set that is identical to the node set, with all blank values replaced by zeros. This example is based on a repeating section with a field named "ages." An alert is shown for the XML generated for the first entry in the node list:
